result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather Koehler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Heather Koehler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Heather Koehler was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant, Heather Koehler, appeared. Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation agent Brett Hammermeister appeared.  All parties agree if defendant has AODA and complies State would not oppose the amendment.  Court ordered defendant to complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any recommendations.    11:06/11:12.
Hearing on December 15, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Letter from defendant re: AODA classes
filed by Attorney Charles Giesen
filed by Attorney Charles Giesen

Defendant Heather Koehler in court with attorney Charles W Giesen.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence  withheld, 1 yr. probation, conds: $579 fine. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. No jail credit. Counts 2&3 dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
